blocks.name: arisum
blocks.content: Arithmetic series sum of the first ` N ` positive integers. This is Metamath 100 proof #68. (Contributed by FL, 16-Nov-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 22-May-2014.)

thm trireciplem(setvar s0, class c0) {

  divcnvshft(hs0, cmpt(s0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cn, nat1, nat1, nat1, universe, wtru)
  1zzd(wtru)

  mptex(s0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))
  nnex()
  1cnd(wtru)
  a1i(wtru, wcel(cseq(nat1, caddc, c0), universe))
  seqex(nat1, caddc, c0)
  eqeltrd(cfv(cmpt(s0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(hs0)), cc, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), wa(wtru, wcel(cv(hs0), cn)))
  recnd(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), wa(wtru, wcel(cv(hs0), cn)))

blocks.name: trirecip
blocks.content: The sum of the reciprocals of the triangle numbers converge to two. This is Metamath 100 proof #42. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 23-Apr-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-May-2014.)

thm trirecip(setvar s0) {
  |- wceq(csu(s0, cn, co(nat2, cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))), nat2)

  eqtr3d(csu(s0, cn, co(nat2, cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))), co(nat2, cmul, nat1), co(nat2, cmul, csu(s0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))), wtru)
  isummulc2(s0, nat2, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), nat1, cmpt(hs0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(hs0), cmul, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)))), wtru)

  climrel()
  2cnd(wtru)
  oveq2d(nat2, cmul, csu(s0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))), nat1, wtru)
  isumclim(s0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), nat1, nat1, cmpt(hs0, cn, co(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(hs0), cmul, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)))), wtru)

  1zzd(wtru)

  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, co(cv(hs0), cmul, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), co(cv(s0), cmul, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
